decks.notes: This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming opponents with an aggressive creature-heavy strategy. The deck includes powerful creatures like Ragavan and Phlage, supported by pumps from Ajani and Guide of Souls. Goblin Bombardment provides additional reach and removal, while Blood Moon disrupts opponents' mana bases. The inclusion of cards like Seasoned Pyromancer and Thraben Charm help generate card advantage and provide flexibility in combat. The mana base includes fetch lands and utility lands like Arena of Glory to ensure consistency and provide additional benefits in the late game.

This deck focuses on quickly loading the board with artifacts and taking advantage of them for aggressive plays. Emry and Tamiyo help with card advantage and recursion, while Quantum Riddler and Cori-Steel Cutter provide strong threats. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Metallic Rebuke and removal with Unholy Heat. Urza's Saga is a key card in this deck, helping to tutor for artifacts and generate additional value. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's aggressive game plan.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with disruptive creatures like Phlage and Ragavan, while also utilizing powerful control elements like Solitude and Consign to Memory. It aims to pressure the opponent with aggressive threats like Quantum Riddler and Phelia, while also presenting a resilient board state with cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Ephemerate. The deck also includes a mix of removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Prismatic Ending, as well as card advantage engines like Teferi, Time Raveler and Meticulous Archive to maintain tempo and grind out value.

The deck focuses on generating mana quickly and efficiently through various rituals and spell effects, in order to cast a large number of spells in a single turn. This leads to chaining spells together to build towards a powerful finisher like Grapeshot. The deck also utilizes card draw and manipulation to help find key pieces and set up explosive turns. Additionally, the deck includes Wrenn's Resolve to protect the combo pieces and ensure the deck can go off uninterrupted. Overall, the deck aims to assemble a lethal combination of cards to overwhelm the opponent and win the game in a single turn.

The deck focuses on quickly playing artifacts and utilizing the synergy between them to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. It also includes cards that disrupt the opponent's strategy and provide additional utility. The goal is to establish a strong board presence and control the game through a combination of efficient creatures, powerful artifacts, and disruptive spells. The deck aims to outpace the opponent and maintain tempo by leveraging the mana acceleration from cards like Mox Opal and Urza's Saga to its advantage.

This Boros Aggro deck aims to flood the board with aggressive creatures like Ajani, Guide of Souls, and Ragavan, while using powerful spells like Galvanic Discharge and Thraben Charm to control the battlefield. The deck also includes cards like Ocelot Pride and Seasoned Pyromancer to generate value and maintain pressure. With cards like Blood Moon and Static Prison to disrupt the opponent's game plan, this deck focuses on fast and efficient aggression to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly drop low-cost artifact creatures onto the battlefield, utilizing cards like Mox Opal and Urza's Saga to generate mana and tokens. The deck focuses on aggressive plays, utilizing cards like Kappa Cannoneer and Pinnacle Emissary to deal damage to the opponent quickly. Other cards like Engineered Explosives and Claws of Gix are used for removal and disruption. The deck also includes cards like Mishra's Bauble and Thoughtcast for card draw and consistency. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and efficient aggro strategy.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying cheap, efficient creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Monastery Swiftspear, backed up by spells like Lightning Bolt and Mutagenic Growth to keep up pressure on opponents. Slickshot Show-Off and Cori-Steel Cutter provide additional threats, while cards like Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration help dig for key pieces. The deck aims to close out games quickly by overwhelming opponents with aggressive creatures and burn spells, using Lava Dart and Unholy Heat as additional removal options. The manabase is designed for consistency and to support the low-to-the-ground strategy.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying cheap artifacts and using them in combination with cards like Claws of Gix and Engineered Explosives to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Salvage Titan provide recursion and value from the graveyard, while cards like Tormod's Crypt and Shadowspear help to handle opposing threats. Urza's Saga is a powerful card advantage engine that can help to find key artifacts like Mishra's Bauble and Mox Opal. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggression and disruption.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with cards like Arboreal Grazer and Lotus Field, while utilizing Amulet of Vigor to untap lands and generate huge amounts of mana. The goal is to quickly summon Primeval Titan to search for key lands like Urza's Saga and Boseiju, Who Endures, allowing for explosive plays and quickly overwhelming the opponent with a large army of creatures. The deck has a strong focus on comboing off and winning the game in a single turn with cards like Scapeshift and Green Sun's Zenith.

This deck focuses on using aggressive creatures like Phelia, Phlage, and Ragavan to pressure the opponent while disrupting their plays with cards like Solitude and Consign to Memory. Quantum Riddler helps control the board, while cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Teferi, Time Raveler provide additional utility. The deck also contains removal spells like Galvanic Discharge and Prismatic Ending to deal with threats. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's aggressive game plan and enable powerful plays.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. By using cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push, it aims to control the board and slow down the opponent's strategy. The deck also utilizes flickering effects with cards like Ephemerate and Flickerwisp to gain additional value from powerful enter-the-battlefield abilities of creatures like Solitude and Witch Enchanter. The mana base is designed to support a variety of colors for the spells in the deck, allowing for versatility and adaptability in different matchups.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by ramping up mana using the UrzaTron lands to play powerful Eldrazi creatures and planeswalkers. The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Kozilek's Command while also generating card advantage and removing threats. Karn, the Great Creator can shut down artifact-based strategies, and Ugin, the Eye of the Storms can clear the board. Overall, this deck aims to establish dominance on the battlefield and overwhelm the opponent with its powerful threats and control elements.

This deck focuses on putting pressure on the opponent early in the game with low-cost, aggressive creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Monastery Swiftspear. The deck also includes a variety of burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart to control the board and finish off opponents quickly. Mishra's Bauble helps dig through the deck for important cards, while Preordain and Expressive Iteration provide card selection and advantage. The deck aims to win quickly and efficiently by overwhelming the opponent with a mix of creatures and burn spells.

The deck focuses on utilizing cheap, efficient creatures and burn spells to apply pressure on the opponent quickly. It aims to control the board with a mix of counterspells and removal spells while deploying threats that can quickly close out the game. The deck also includes card filtering spells to ensure consistency in drawing threats and answers. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive game plan while providing access to the necessary colors for spells. Overall, the deck aims to be fast, disruptive, and resilient in the Modern format.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's actions through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage engines like Narset, Parter of Veils. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while developing its own resources, eventually winning through a combination of powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and powerful spells like Supreme Verdict. The inclusion of Kaheera as a companion provides additional value and utility to the deck, making it a versatile and resilient control deck in the Modern format.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying powerful creatures and using spells to control the board and protect those creatures. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays and efficient removal, while also utilizing Leylines to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The diverse mana base allows for flexibility in casting spells and activating abilities, while also providing consistency in resource management. The combination of high-impact creatures and versatile spells makes this deck a formidable force in Modern 1 vs 1 matches.

This deck focuses on using Allosaurus Rider along with Eldritch Evolution and Neoform to quickly ramp into powerful threats such as Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant and Griselbrand. The deck utilizes cards like Planar Genesis and Xenagos, God of Revels to generate additional value and finish off opponents quickly. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Pact of Negation and Veil of Summer to protect its combo pieces and ensure a smooth combo execution. With a mix of ramp, protection, and powerful creatures, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its explosive combo potential.

The deck focuses on utilizing Amulet of Vigor to ramp up mana and untap lands, allowing for explosive plays with Primeval Titan and Azusa, Lost but Seeking. The goal is to quickly search for key lands like Gruul Turf and Urza's Saga, and set up for powerful combos with cards like Summoner's Pact, Scapeshift, and Green Sun's Zenith. The deck relies on generating mana efficiently and manipulating the battlefield to overwhelm the opponent with large creatures and game-winning combos.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy. The key cards in this deck are focused on creating a powerful board presence with creatures like Ajani, Guide of Souls, and Ragavan, while also dealing direct damage with spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment. The inclusion of cards like Seasoned Pyromancer and Voice of Victory helps to generate value and maintain card advantage throughout the game. Additionally, the deck includes disruptive elements like Thraben Charm and Blood Moon to disrupt the opponent's game plan and secure victory.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The key strategy is to play efficient creatures like Ragavan and seasoned Pyromancer early on, followed by using burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to finish off the opponent. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah provides additional synergy with tokens, while cards like Voice of Victory and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker offer strong late-game options. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Mana Tithe and Blood Moon to disrupt opponent's plans. Additionally, the mana base is optimized to support the aggressive playstyle.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through ramping up Eldrazi creatures and utilizing various spells and abilities to disrupt the opponent's strategy. By consistently ramping up mana with cards like Utopia Sprawl and Eldrazi Temple, this deck can quickly play powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and Devourer of Destiny. Spells like Kozilek's Command and Malevolent Rumble provide additional control options, while cards like Writhing Chrysalis and Sowing Mycospawn can generate additional threats. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm and outmaneuver the opponent through a combination of ramp and control elements.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize a combination of powerful creatures and spells to quickly reanimate creatures from the graveyard, creating powerful combos and synergies. Cards like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Psychic Frog can be brought back from the graveyard with cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate, while also protecting your plays with cards like Force of Negation and Fatal Push. The deck's mana base allows for flexibility in casting a variety of spells, making it a versatile and dynamic deck focused on instant reanimation and combo potential.

This deck aims to play aggressively while disrupting the opponent's game plan by using a combination of efficient creatures and disruptive spells. By incorporating cards that exile threats, control the opponent's hand size, and provide card advantage, this deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent while disrupting their resources. The inclusion of land hate cards can also punish greedy mana bases and further disrupt the opponent's game plan. Ultimately, this deck aims to apply pressure while controlling the tempo of the game to secure a win.

The main concept of the deck is to utilize a combination of creatures and spells to quickly generate mana and cast powerful spells without the need for traditional lands. By utilizing cards such as Fallaji Archaeologist, Hydroelectric Specimen, and Tameshi, Reality Architect, the deck aims to quickly assemble a powerful combination of cards to overwhelm the opponent. Additionally, the deck includes disruptive elements such as Disrupting Shoal and Sink into Stupor to control the opponent's resources and protect its own game plan. Ultimately, the goal is to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent using a unique landless combo strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly generate mana through rituals and medallions to cast a high quantity of spells in a single turn, ultimately leading to a lethal Grapeshot finish. Ral, Monsoon Mage and Wrenn's Resolve provide card advantage and protection for the combo pieces, while Past in Flames allows for spell recursion. Valakut Awakening serves as both a potential wheel effect and a way to dig deeper into the deck. The deck focuses on chaining spells together efficiently to create a storm of spells that overwhelm the opponent.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with Birthing Ritual and using it to play powerful creatures like Abhorrent Oculus and Ice-Fang Coatl to overwhelm the opponent. It also includes disruptive spells like Flare of Denial and Sink into Stupor to control the board. The deck combines the aggression of an aggro strategy with the versatility of Simic's creature abilities and card draw, making it a formidable force in Modern 1 vs 1 matches.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on playing low-cost creatures and spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. Dragon's Rage Channeler and Monastery Swiftspear provide early aggression, while Slickshot Show-Off and Cori-Steel Cutter offer additional damage and disruption. Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration help filter through the deck for more threats, while Lava Dart and Lightning Bolt serve as efficient removal and burn spells. The deck aims to be fast and proactive, pressuring the opponent early and closing out the game before they can stabilize.

This deck focuses on playing low-cost aggressive creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Monastery Swiftspear, along with efficient burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It also includes cards like Slickshot Show-Off and Cori-Steel Cutter to maintain pressure on the opponent. In addition, it has cards like Mishra's Bauble and Surgical Extraction to disrupt the opponent's game plan and keep the aggression going. The deck aims to keep the pressure on the opponent and close out the game quickly.

The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly swarm the battlefield with aggressive creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Monastery Swiftspear, while using efficient spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart to control the opponent's board and push through damage. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Slickshot Show-Off and Mishra's Bauble to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to play fast and aggressively, overwhelming the opponent with a combination of creatures and direct damage spells to secure a quick victory.

The main concept of this deck is to control the board through the use of powerful Eldrazi creatures and interactive spells, while also utilizing the UrzaTron lands to ramp up and cast big threats like Emrakul, the Promised End. The deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's game plan with cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Glaring Fleshraker, while also using Planeswalkers like Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, the Eye of the Storms to further control the battlefield. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its powerful creatures and spells while maintaining control of the game.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly through the Urza lands to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures and control spells. Karn, the Great Creator is used to access sideboard cards to deal with various threats. Devourer of Destiny and Glaring Fleshraker provide early game pressure, while Thought-Knot Seer and Sire of Seven Deaths disrupt the opponent's game plan. Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and All Is Dust serve as board wipes, ensuring control of the battlefield. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with high-impact threats and disruptive spells.
